page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: Stage bus services connect to Swindon, Marlborough and Hungerford and local villages with about 6 trips a day. Barnes Coaches run regular trips to Newbury, holiday tours and trips to popular events and group outings, as well as the daily school run to Marlborough. Cars and to a lesser extent motorcycles are essential for most of those working outside the village. Bicycles are used locally, largely for recreation. Youngsters move from mini-bikes at 5, to BMX cycles at 10 and lightweight motorbikes at 16 years. Most are qualified car drivers at 18. Elderly drivers keep going, often in equally elderly cars. There is a taxi for hire and lifts, casual or arranged, are important when public services are infrequent and wayward. Without trucks and vans we would starve and freeze
